intro: Scuticaria irwiniana, commonly known as the Irwin's scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of swamps and wetlands. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Scuticaria irwiniana is often found in wetland habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
